answers.answer: Various mental health services are available, including unique workshops, specialized psychological and psychiatric support, mental health consultations, psychosocial support, and psychological first aid.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Individuals can sign up for the workshops by contacting the ALIAT Association team at the email address inside@aliatong.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Mental health services for refugees from Ukraine ALIAT Association'.

answers.answer: Atelier Psy Clinic offers specialized psychological and psychiatric support including psychology, psychiatry, adult psychiatry, pediatric psychiatry, and addiction treatment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Atelier Psy Clinic'.

answers.answer: Red Cross Romania offers mental health consultations and psychological support in Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Psychological support in Bucharest Red Cross Romania'.

answers.answer: The workshops take place every Wednesday at the Aliat Clinic and Fridays at the Sante Clinic.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Mental health services for refugees from Ukraine ALIAT Association'.

answers.answer: The Terre des hommes Foundation offers psychological assistance to refugees from Ukraine, third-country nationals, local Romanian population, pregnant/nursing women, children, LGBTIQ+, Roma community, and unaccompanied children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Terre des hommes Foundation'.

answers.answer: Hias organizes MHPSS capacity building events for humanitarian workers through trainings, seminars, webinars, and supervision.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Hias'.

answers.answer: Project HOPE provides psychological consultations in Ukrainian, Russian, Romanian, English, and Polish.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Project HOPE'.

answers.answer: IOM provides psychological support by referencing vulnerable individuals to resources, organizing psychosocial support and mental health awareness events, offering mental health first aid, and conducting training, workshops, and supervision.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'The International Organization for Migration (IOM)'.

answers.answer: To obtain mental health services from the Estuar Foundation, one can contact Amedeea Enache via email at amedeea.enache@estuar.org or by phone at +40753088675.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'The Estuar Foundation'.

answers.answer: MHPSS support sessions by the AMURTEL team are available from Monday to Friday during business hours, by contacting Alona Radchenko.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'The AMURTEL team'.

answers.answer: Contre la Faim offers referral to specialists, community-based and targeted psychosocial support, mental health awareness, psychological first aid, and MHPSS capacity building for humanitarian and aid workers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'The Contre la Faim organization'.

answers.answer: Psychological support in other cities of Romania can be found by selecting the desired city in the “Other cities“ item in the main menu, where all necessary information will be available.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Psychological support in other cities of Romania'.

answers.answer: The International Rescue Committee offers psychological assistance to Ukrainian refugees, third-country nationals, the local population of Romania, survivors of gender violence, people with serious mental illnesses, unaccompanied children, and the Roma community.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'The International Rescue Committee'.

answers.answer: One can contact Necuvinte Association for psychological assistance by reaching out to Ana Patricia Popa, Clinical Psychologist, via email at ana.popa@necuvinte.ro or by phone at +40770165771.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees and read the section under 'Necuvinte Association'.
